 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָהַם‎</span>] **verb** ==growl, groan== (Late Hebrew id.; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְהַם‎</span>); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְנָהַמְתָּ֫‎</span> [[Prov.5.11|Prov 5:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּנְהַמְתֶּם‎</span> [[Ezek.24.23|Ezek 24:23]] ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִנְהֹם‎</span> [[Isa.5.29|Isa 5:29]]; [[Isa.5.30|Isa 5:30]] **Participle** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֹהֵם‎</span> [[Prov.28.15|Prov 28:15]] — 

**1.** ***growl***, of a lion (namely while it is devouring its prey: opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁאנ‎</span>, of ***roar*** with which it springs upon it [[BDB#RS|RS]]<sup>Proph. 243</sup>) [[Prov.28.15|Prov 28:15]], of Assyr. (under figure of lion) [[Isa.5.29|Isa 5:29]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> (***over***), v[[Isa.5.30|Isa 5:30]]. 

**2.** ***groan***, of sufferer [[Prov.5.11|Prov 5:11]]; [[Ezek.24.23|Ezek 24:23]].
